description:
This Independent Study Module offers an opportunity for students to develop and design their own special topics/contents pertinent to Southeast Asiaâs history, politics, economics, and culture. The emphasis is on critical reading and discussion of scholarship written and published in Southeast Asiaâs vernacular languages, e.g., Bahasa Indonesia, Burmese, Khmer, Laos, Malay, Tagalog,
Thai, and Vietnamese. It encourages students with advanced training or fieldwork experience to further engage critical and comparative scholarship from different perspectives.
title: Special Readings in a SE Asian Language
prerequisite: Students must be enroled in the MA or Ph.D Research programmes.
